description: Retrieves the Resolver configurations that you have defined. Route 53 Resolver uses the configurations to manage DNS resolution behavior for your VPCs.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: (Optional) If the current Amazon Web Services account has more than MaxResults Resolver configurations, use NextToken to get the second and subsequent pages of results. For the first ListResolverConfigs request, omit this value. For the second and subsequent requests, get the value of NextToken from the previous response and specify that value for NextToken in the request.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If a response includes the last of the Resolver configurations that are associated with the current Amazon Web Services account, NextToken doesn't appear in the response.

nested_items.name: ResolverConfigs
nested_items.description: An array that contains one ResolverConfigs element for each Resolver configuration that is associated with the current Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud VPC or a Route 53 Profile that you're configuring Resolver for.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The owner account ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud VPC.

nested_items.name: AutodefinedReverse
nested_items.description: The status of whether or not the Resolver will create autodefined rules for reverse DNS lookups. This is enabled by default. The status can be one of following:
